name: silicon-notes
description: Silicon is a code image generator that turns source snippets into beautiful images. Itâ€™s mainly a CLI tool but can be wrapped in web workflows, ideal for sharing code on social media or blogs.
features: Code to image: Converts source code snippets into beautiful syntax-highlighted images.
Syntax highlighting: Supports hundreds of programming languages with accurate highlighting.
Theme selection: Applies popular color themes like Dracula, Monokai, and Solarized.
Custom backgrounds: Sets solid colors, gradients, or transparent backgrounds.
Font customization: Chooses from various monospace fonts for code rendering.
Shadow effects: Adds drop shadows and window chrome for polished appearance.
Line numbers: Optionally displays line numbers alongside code.
Padding control: Adjusts padding and margins around code blocks.
Export formats: Saves images as PNG or SVG for different use cases.
CLI interface: Generates images from command line for automation and scripts.
Batch processing: Converts multiple code files to images in one command.
Window decorations: Adds macOS-style window controls for realistic screenshots.
